00129 BOOLEAN InitializeVideoSurfaceManager( )
00130 {
00131       //Shouldn't be calling this if the video surface manager already exists.
00132       //Call shutdown first...
00133       Assert( !gpVSurfaceHead );
00134       Assert( !gpVSurfaceTail );
00135       RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, "Video Surface Manager");
00136       gpVSurfaceHead = gpVSurfaceTail = NULL;
00137 
00138       giMemUsedInSurfaces = 0;
00139 
00140       // Create primary and backbuffer from globals
00141       if ( !SetPrimaryVideoSurfaces( ) )
00142       {
00143     DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_1, String( "Could not create primary surfaces" ) );
00144             return FALSE;
00145       }
00146 
00147       return TRUE ;
00148 }
00149 
00150 BOOLEAN ShutdownVideoSurfaceManager( )
00151 {
00152       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
00153 
00154   DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Shutting down the Video Surface manager");
00155 
00156       // Delete primary viedeo surfaces
00157       DeletePrimaryVideoSurfaces( );
00158 
00159       while( gpVSurfaceHead )
00160       {
00161             curr = gpVSurfaceHead;
00162             gpVSurfaceHead = gpVSurfaceHead->next;
00163             DeleteVideoSurface( curr->hVSurface );
00164             #ifdef SGP_VIDEO_DEBUGGING
00165                   if( curr->pName )
00166                         MemFree( curr->pName );
00167                   if( curr->pCode )
00168                         MemFree( curr->pCode );
00169             #endif
00170             MemFree( curr );
00171       }
00172       gpVSurfaceHead = NULL;
00173       gpVSurfaceTail = NULL;
00174       guiVSurfaceIndex = 0;
00175       guiVSurfaceSize = 0;
00176       guiVSurfaceTotalAdded = 0;
00177       UnRegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, "Video Objects");
00178       return TRUE;
00179 }
00180 
00181 
00182 BOOLEAN RestoreVideoSurfaces( )
00183 {
00184       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
00185 
00186   //
00187       // Loop through Video Surfaces and Restore
00188   //
00189       curr = gpVSurfaceTail;
00190       while( curr )
00191       {
00192             if( !RestoreVideoSurface( curr->hVSurface ) )
00193             {
00194                   return FALSE;
00195             }
00196             curr = curr->prev;
00197       }
00198       return TRUE;
00199 }

00201 
00202 BOOLEAN AddStandardVideoSurface( VSURFACE_DESC *pVSurfaceDesc, UINT32 *puiIndex )
00203 {
00204 
00205       HVSURFACE hVSurface;
00206 
00207       // Assertions
00208       Assert( puiIndex );
00209       Assert( pVSurfaceDesc );
00210 
00211       // Create video object
00212       hVSurface = CreateVideoSurface( pVSurfaceDesc );
00213 
00214       if( !hVSurface )
00215       {
00216             // Video Object will set error condition.
00217             return FALSE ;
00218       }
00219 
00220       // Set transparency to default
00221       SetVideoSurfaceTransparencyColor( hVSurface, FROMRGB( 0, 0, 0 ) );
00222 
00223       // Set into video object list
00224       if( gpVSurfaceHead )
00225       { //Add node after tail
00226             gpVSurfaceTail->next = (VSURFACE_NODE*)MemAlloc( sizeof( VSURFACE_NODE ) );
00227             Assert( gpVSurfaceTail->next ); //out of memory?
00228             gpVSurfaceTail->next->prev = gpVSurfaceTail;
00229             gpVSurfaceTail->next->next = NULL;
00230             gpVSurfaceTail = gpVSurfaceTail->next;
00231       }
00232       else
00233       { //new list
00234             gpVSurfaceHead = (VSURFACE_NODE*)MemAlloc( sizeof( VSURFACE_NODE ) );
00235             Assert( gpVSurfaceHead ); //out of memory?
00236             gpVSurfaceHead->prev = gpVSurfaceHead->next = NULL;
00237             gpVSurfaceTail = gpVSurfaceHead;
00238       }
00239       #ifdef SGP_VIDEO_DEBUGGING
00240             gpVSurfaceTail->pName = NULL;
00241             gpVSurfaceTail->pCode = NULL;
00242       #endif
00243       //Set the hVSurface into the node.
00244       gpVSurfaceTail->hVSurface = hVSurface;
00245       gpVSurfaceTail->uiIndex = guiVSurfaceIndex+=2;
00246       *puiIndex = gpVSurfaceTail->uiIndex;
00247       Assert( guiVSurfaceIndex < 0xfffffff0 ); //unlikely that we will ever use 2 billion VSurfaces!
00248       //We would have to create about 70 VSurfaces per second for 1 year straight to achieve this...
00249       guiVSurfaceSize++;
00250       guiVSurfaceTotalAdded++;
00251 
00252       return TRUE ;
00253 }

00255 
00256 BYTE *LockVideoSurface( UINT32 uiVSurface, UINT32 *puiPitch )
00257 {
00258       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
00259 
00260   //
00261   // Check if given backbuffer or primary buffer
00262   //
00263 #ifdef JA2
00264   if ( uiVSurface == PRIMARY_SURFACE )
00265   {
00266     return (BYTE *)LockPrimarySurface( puiPitch );
00267   }
00268 
00269   if ( uiVSurface == BACKBUFFER )
00270   {
00271     return (BYTE *)LockBackBuffer( puiPitch );
00272   }
00273 #endif
00274 
00275   if ( uiVSurface == FRAME_BUFFER )
00276   {
00277     return (BYTE *)LockFrameBuffer( puiPitch );
00278   }
00279 
00280   if ( uiVSurface == MOUSE_BUFFER )
00281   {
00282     return (BYTE *)LockMouseBuffer( puiPitch );
00283   }
00284 
00285   //
00286   // Otherwise, use list
00287   //
00288 
00289       curr = gpVSurfaceHead;
00290       while( curr )
00291       {
00292             if( curr->uiIndex == uiVSurface )
00293             {
00294                   break;
00295             }
00296             curr = curr->next;
00297       }
00298       if( !curr )
00299       {
00300             return FALSE;
00301       }
00302 
00303   //
00304       // Lock buffer
00305   //
00306 
00307       return LockVideoSurfaceBuffer( curr->hVSurface, puiPitch );
00308 
00309 }
00310 
00311 void UnLockVideoSurface( UINT32 uiVSurface )
00312 {
00313       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
00314 
00315   //
00316   // Check if given backbuffer or primary buffer
00317   //
00318 #ifdef JA2
00319   if ( uiVSurface == PRIMARY_SURFACE )
00320   {
00321     UnlockPrimarySurface();
00322     return;
00323   }
00324 
00325   if ( uiVSurface == BACKBUFFER )
00326   {
00327     UnlockBackBuffer();
00328     return;
00329   }
00330 #endif
00331 
00332   if ( uiVSurface == FRAME_BUFFER )
00333   {
00334     UnlockFrameBuffer();
00335     return;
00336   }
00337 
00338   if ( uiVSurface == MOUSE_BUFFER )
00339   {
00340     UnlockMouseBuffer();
00341     return;
00342   }
00343 
00344       curr = gpVSurfaceHead;
00345       while( curr )
00346       {
00347             if( curr->uiIndex == uiVSurface )
00348             {
00349                   break;
00350             }
00351             curr = curr->next;
00352       }
00353       if( !curr )
00354       {
00355     return;
00356   }
00357 
00358   //
00359       // unlock buffer
00360   //
00361 
00362       UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer( curr->hVSurface );
00363 }

00410 BOOLEAN GetVideoSurfaceDescription( UINT32 uiIndex, UINT16 *usWidth, UINT16 *usHeight, UINT8 *ubBitDepth )
00411 {
00412       HVSURFACE hVSurface;
00413 
00414       Assert( usWidth != NULL );
00415       Assert( usHeight != NULL );
00416       Assert( ubBitDepth != NULL );
00417 
00418   //
00419       // Get Video Surface
00420   //
00421 
00422       #ifdef _DEBUG
00423             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_GETVIDEOSURFACEDESCRIPTION;
00424       #endif
00425       CHECKF( GetVideoSurface( &hVSurface, uiIndex ) );
00426 
00427       *usWidth = hVSurface->usWidth;
00428       *usHeight = hVSurface->usHeight;
00429       *ubBitDepth = hVSurface->ubBitDepth;
00430 
00431       return TRUE;
00432 }
00433 
00434 BOOLEAN GetVideoSurface( HVSURFACE *hVSurface, UINT32 uiIndex )
00435 {
00436       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
00437 
00438       #ifdef _DEBUG
00439             CheckValidVSurfaceIndex( uiIndex );
00440       #endif
00441 
00442   if ( uiIndex == PRIMARY_SURFACE )
00443   {
00444     *hVSurface = ghPrimary;
00445             return TRUE;
00446   }
00447 
00448   if ( uiIndex == BACKBUFFER )
00449   {
00450     *hVSurface = ghBackBuffer;
00451             return TRUE;
00452   }
00453 
00454   if ( uiIndex == FRAME_BUFFER )
00455   {
00456     *hVSurface = ghFrameBuffer;
00457             return TRUE;
00458   }
00459 
00460   if ( uiIndex == MOUSE_BUFFER )
00461   {
00462     *hVSurface = ghMouseBuffer;
00463             return TRUE;
00464   }
00465 
00466       curr = gpVSurfaceHead;
00467       while( curr )
00468       {
00469             if( curr->uiIndex == uiIndex )
00470             {
00471                   *hVSurface = curr->hVSurface;
00472                   return TRUE;
00473             }
00474             curr = curr->next;
00475       }
00476   return FALSE;
00477 }

00479 BOOLEAN SetPrimaryVideoSurfaces( )
00480 {
00481       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2 pSurface;
00482 
00483       // Delete surfaces if they exist
00484       DeletePrimaryVideoSurfaces( );
00485 
00486   //
00487       // Get Primary surface
00488   //
00489 #ifdef JA2
00490       pSurface = GetPrimarySurfaceObject();
00491       CHECKF( pSurface != NULL );
00492 
00493       ghPrimary = CreateVideoSurfaceFromDDSurface( pSurface );
00494       CHECKF( ghPrimary != NULL );
00495 
00496   //
00497       // Get Backbuffer surface
00498   //
00499 
00500       pSurface = GetBackBufferObject( );
00501       CHECKF( pSurface != NULL );
00502 
00503       ghBackBuffer = CreateVideoSurfaceFromDDSurface( pSurface );
00504       CHECKF( ghBackBuffer != NULL );
00505 
00506   //
00507       // Get mouse buffer surface
00508   //
00509       pSurface = GetMouseBufferObject( );
00510       CHECKF( pSurface != NULL );
00511 
00512       ghMouseBuffer = CreateVideoSurfaceFromDDSurface( pSurface );
00513       CHECKF( ghMouseBuffer != NULL );
00514 
00515 #endif
00516 
00517   //
00518       // Get frame buffer surface
00519   //
00520 
00521       pSurface = GetFrameBufferObject( );
00522       CHECKF( pSurface != NULL );
00523 
00524       ghFrameBuffer = CreateVideoSurfaceFromDDSurface( pSurface );
00525       CHECKF( ghFrameBuffer != NULL );
00526 
00527 
00528       return( TRUE );
00529 }
00530 
00531 void DeletePrimaryVideoSurfaces( )
00532 {
00533   //
00534       // If globals are not null, delete them
00535   //
00536 
00537       if ( ghPrimary != NULL )
00538       {
00539             DeleteVideoSurface( ghPrimary );
00540             ghPrimary = NULL;
00541       }
00542 
00543       if ( ghBackBuffer != NULL )
00544       {
00545             DeleteVideoSurface( ghBackBuffer );
00546             ghBackBuffer = NULL;
00547       }
00548 
00549   if ( ghFrameBuffer != NULL )
00550       {
00551             DeleteVideoSurface( ghFrameBuffer );
00552             ghFrameBuffer = NULL;
00553       }
00554 
00555       if ( ghMouseBuffer != NULL )
00556       {
00557             DeleteVideoSurface( ghMouseBuffer );
00558             ghMouseBuffer = NULL;
00559       }
00560 
00561 }
00562 
00563 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00564 //
00565 // Given an index to the dest and src vobject contained in our private VSurface list
00566 // Based on flags, blit accordingly
00567 // There are two types, a BltFast and a Blt. BltFast is 10% faster, uses no
00568 // clipping lists
00569 //
00570 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00571 
00572 BOOLEAN BltVideoSurface(UINT32 uiDestVSurface, UINT32 uiSrcVSurface, UINT16 usRegionIndex, INT32 iDestX, INT32 iDestY, UINT32 fBltFlags, blt_vs_fx *pBltFx )
00573 {
00574 
00575       HVSURFACE   hDestVSurface;
00576       HVSURFACE   hSrcVSurface;
00577 
00578       #ifdef _DEBUG
00579             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_BLTVIDEOSURFACE_DST;
00580       #endif
00581       if( !GetVideoSurface( &hDestVSurface, uiDestVSurface ) )
00582       {
00583             return FALSE;
00584       }
00585       #ifdef _DEBUG
00586             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_BLTVIDEOSURFACE_SRC;
00587       #endif
00588       if( !GetVideoSurface( &hSrcVSurface, uiSrcVSurface ) )
00589       {
00590             return FALSE;
00591       }
00592       if ( !BltVideoSurfaceToVideoSurface( hDestVSurface, hSrcVSurface, usRegionIndex, iDestX, iDestY, fBltFlags, pBltFx ) )
00593       { // VO Blitter will set debug messages for error conditions
00594             return FALSE ;
00595       }
00596       return TRUE ;
00597 }

00599 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00600 //
00601 // Fills an rectangular area with a specified color value.
00602 //
00603 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00604 
00605 BOOLEAN ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(UINT32 uiDestVSurface, INT32 iDestX1, INT32 iDestY1, INT32 iDestX2, INT32 iDestY2, UINT16 Color16BPP)
00606 {
00607       blt_vs_fx BltFx;
00608       HVSURFACE   hDestVSurface;
00609       SGPRect Clip;
00610 
00611       #ifdef _DEBUG
00612             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_COLORFILLVIDEOSURFACEAREA;
00613       #endif
00614       if( !GetVideoSurface( &hDestVSurface, uiDestVSurface ) )
00615       {
00616             return FALSE;
00617       }
00618 
00619       BltFx.ColorFill = Color16BPP;
00620       BltFx.DestRegion = 0;
00621 
00622   //
00623       // Clip fill region coords
00624   //
00625 
00626       GetClippingRect(&Clip);
00627 
00628       if(iDestX1 < Clip.iLeft)
00629             iDestX1 = Clip.iLeft;
00630 
00631       if(iDestX1 > Clip.iRight)
00632             return(FALSE);
00633 
00634       if(iDestX2 > Clip.iRight)
00635             iDestX2 = Clip.iRight;
00636 
00637       if(iDestX2 < Clip.iLeft)
00638             return(FALSE);
00639 
00640       if(iDestY1 < Clip.iTop)
00641             iDestY1 = Clip.iTop;
00642 
00643       if(iDestY1 > Clip.iBottom)
00644             return(FALSE);
00645 
00646       if(iDestY2 > Clip.iBottom)
00647             iDestY2 = Clip.iBottom;
00648 
00649       if(iDestY2 < Clip.iTop)
00650             return(FALSE);
00651 
00652       if((iDestX2 <= iDestX1) || (iDestY2 <= iDestY1))
00653             return(FALSE);
00654 
00655       BltFx.SrcRect.iLeft =   BltFx.FillRect.iLeft = iDestX1;
00656       BltFx.SrcRect.iTop = BltFx.FillRect.iTop = iDestY1;
00657       BltFx.SrcRect.iRight = BltFx.FillRect.iRight = iDestX2;
00658       BltFx.SrcRect.iBottom = BltFx.FillRect.iBottom = iDestY2;
00659 
00660       return( FillSurfaceRect( hDestVSurface, &BltFx ) );
00661 }
00662 
00663 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00664 //
00665 // Fills an rectangular area with a specified image value.
00666 //
00667 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00668 
00669 BOOLEAN ImageFillVideoSurfaceArea(UINT32 uiDestVSurface, INT32 iDestX1, INT32 iDestY1, INT32 iDestX2, INT32 iDestY2, HVOBJECT BkgrndImg, UINT16 Index, INT16 Ox, INT16 Oy)
00670 {
00671       INT16 xc,yc,hblits,wblits,aw,pw,ah,ph,w,h,xo,yo;
00672       ETRLEObject       *pTrav;
00673       SGPRect NewClip,OldClip;
00674 
00675       pTrav = &(BkgrndImg->pETRLEObject[Index]);
00676       ph = (INT16)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00677       pw = (INT16)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00678 
00679       ah = (INT16)(iDestY2-iDestY1);
00680       aw = (INT16)(iDestX2-iDestX1);
00681 
00682       Ox %= pw;
00683       Oy %= ph;
00684 
00685       if(Ox>0)
00686             Ox -= pw;
00687       xo = (-Ox)%pw;
00688 
00689       if(Oy>0)
00690             Oy -= ph;
00691       yo = (-Oy)%ph;
00692 
00693       if(Ox<0)
00694             xo = (-Ox)%pw;
00695       else
00696       {
00697             xo = pw-(Ox%pw);
00698             Ox -= pw;
00699       }
00700 
00701       if(Oy<0)
00702             yo = (-Oy)%ph;
00703       else
00704       {
00705             yo = ph-(Oy%pw);
00706             Oy -= ph;
00707       }
00708 
00709       hblits = ((ah+yo)/ph) + (((ah+yo)%ph)?1:0);
00710       wblits = ((aw+xo)/pw) + (((aw+xo)%pw)?1:0);
00711 
00712       if((hblits==0) || (wblits==0))
00713             return(FALSE);
00714 
00715   //
00716       // Clip fill region coords
00717   //
00718 
00719       GetClippingRect(&OldClip);
00720 
00721       NewClip.iLeft=iDestX1;
00722       NewClip.iTop=iDestY1;
00723       NewClip.iRight=iDestX2;
00724       NewClip.iBottom=iDestY2;
00725 
00726       if(NewClip.iLeft < OldClip.iLeft)
00727             NewClip.iLeft = OldClip.iLeft;
00728 
00729       if(NewClip.iLeft > OldClip.iRight)
00730             return(FALSE);
00731 
00732       if(NewClip.iRight > OldClip.iRight)
00733             NewClip.iRight = OldClip.iRight;
00734 
00735       if(NewClip.iRight < OldClip.iLeft)
00736             return(FALSE);
00737 
00738       if(NewClip.iTop < OldClip.iTop)
00739             NewClip.iTop = OldClip.iTop;
00740 
00741       if(NewClip.iTop > OldClip.iBottom)
00742             return(FALSE);
00743 
00744       if(NewClip.iBottom > OldClip.iBottom)
00745             NewClip.iBottom = OldClip.iBottom;
00746 
00747       if(NewClip.iBottom < OldClip.iTop)
00748             return(FALSE);
00749 
00750       if((NewClip.iRight <= NewClip.iLeft) || (NewClip.iBottom <= NewClip.iTop))
00751             return(FALSE);
00752 
00753       SetClippingRect(&NewClip);
00754 
00755       yc = (INT16)iDestY1;
00756       for(h=0;h<hblits;h++)
00757       {
00758             xc = (INT16)iDestX1;
00759             for(w=0;w<wblits;w++)
00760             {
00761                   BltVideoObject(uiDestVSurface, BkgrndImg, Index, xc+Ox, yc+Oy, VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY, NULL);
00762                   xc += pw;
00763             }
00764             yc += ph;
00765       }
00766 
00767       SetClippingRect(&OldClip);
00768       return(TRUE);
00769 }
00770 
00771 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00772 //
00773 // Video Surface Manipulation Functions
00774 //
00775 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00776 
00777 HVSURFACE CreateVideoSurface( VSURFACE_DESC *VSurfaceDesc )
00778 {
00779       LPDIRECTDRAW2                       lpDD2Object;
00780   DDSURFACEDESC                     SurfaceDescription;
00781       DDPIXELFORMAT                   PixelFormat;
00782       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE  lpDDS;
00783       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2  lpDDS2;
00784       HVSURFACE                                 hVSurface;
00785       HIMAGE                                          hImage;
00786       SGPRect                                         tempRect;
00787       UINT16                                          usHeight;
00788       UINT16                                          usWidth;
00789       UINT8                                           ubBitDepth;
00790       UINT32                                          fMemUsage;
00791 
00792 //#ifdef JA2
00793       UINT32                                          uiRBitMask;
00794       UINT32                                          uiGBitMask;
00795       UINT32                                          uiBBitMask;
00796 //#endif
00797 
00798       //Clear the memory
00799       memset( &SurfaceDescription, 0, sizeof( DDSURFACEDESC ) );
00800 
00801   //
00802       // Get Direct Draw Object
00803   //
00804 
00805       lpDD2Object = GetDirectDraw2Object( );
00806 
00807   //
00808       // The description structure contains memory usage flag
00809   //
00810 #ifdef JA2
00811       fMemUsage = VSurfaceDesc->fCreateFlags;
00812 #else
00813       fMemUsage = VSURFACE_SYSTEM_MEM_USAGE;
00814 #endif
00815 
00816   //
00817       // Check creation options
00818   //
00819 
00820       do
00821       {
00822     //
00823             // Check if creating from file
00824     //
00825 
00826             if ( VSurfaceDesc->fCreateFlags & VSURFACE_CREATE_FROMFILE )
00827             {
00828       //
00829                   // Create himage object from file
00830       //
00831 
00832                   hImage = CreateImage( VSurfaceDesc->ImageFile, IMAGE_ALLIMAGEDATA );
00833 
00834                   if ( hImage == NULL )
00835                   {
00836                               DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Invalid Image Filename given" );
00837                               return( NULL );
00838                   }
00839 
00840       //
00841                   // Set values from himage
00842       //
00843                   usHeight = hImage->usHeight;
00844                   usWidth = hImage->usWidth;
00845                   ubBitDepth = hImage->ubBitDepth;
00846                   break;
00847             }
00848 
00849 
00850     //
00851             // If here, no special options given,
00852             // Set values from given description structure
00853     //
00854 
00855             usHeight = VSurfaceDesc->usHeight;
00856             usWidth = VSurfaceDesc->usWidth;
00857             ubBitDepth = VSurfaceDesc->ubBitDepth;
00858 
00859       }     while( FALSE );
00860 
00861   //
00862       // Assertions
00863   //
00864 
00865       Assert ( usHeight > 0 );
00866       Assert ( usWidth > 0 );
00867 
00868   //
00869       // Setup Direct Draw Description
00870       // First do Pixel Format
00871   //
00872 
00873       memset( &PixelFormat, 0, sizeof( PixelFormat ) );
00874       PixelFormat.dwSize = sizeof( DDPIXELFORMAT );
00875 
00876       switch( ubBitDepth )
00877       {
00878 
00879             case 8:
00880 
00881                   PixelFormat.dwFlags = DDPF_RGB | DDPF_PALETTEINDEXED8;
00882                   PixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount = 8;
00883                   break;
00884 
00885             case 16:
00886 
00887                   PixelFormat.dwFlags = DDPF_RGB;
00888                   PixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount = 16;
00889 
00890       //
00891                   // Get current Pixel Format from DirectDraw
00892       //
00893 
00894 // We're using pixel formats too -- DB/Wiz
00895 
00896 //#ifdef JA2
00897                   CHECKF( GetPrimaryRGBDistributionMasks( &uiRBitMask, &uiGBitMask, &uiBBitMask ) );
00898                   PixelFormat.dwRBitMask = uiRBitMask;
00899                   PixelFormat.dwGBitMask = uiGBitMask;
00900                   PixelFormat.dwBBitMask = uiBBitMask;
00901 //#else
00902 //                PixelFormat.dwRBitMask = 0xf800;
00903 //                PixelFormat.dwGBitMask = 0x7e0;
00904 //                PixelFormat.dwBBitMask = 0x1f;
00905 //#endif
00906                   break;
00907 
00908             default:
00909 
00910       //
00911                   // If Here, an invalid format was given
00912       //
00913 
00914                   DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, "Invalid BPP value, can only be 8 or 16." );
00915                   return( FALSE );
00916       }
00917 
00918        SurfaceDescription.dwFlags = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_HEIGHT | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_PIXELFORMAT;
00919 
00920   //
00921       // Do memory description, based on specified flags
00922   //
00923 
00924       do
00925       {
00926             if ( fMemUsage & VSURFACE_DEFAULT_MEM_USAGE )
00927             {
00928                   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;
00929                   break;
00930             }
00931             if ( fMemUsage & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE )
00932             {
00933                   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;
00934                   break;
00935             }
00936 
00937             if ( fMemUsage & VSURFACE_SYSTEM_MEM_USAGE )
00938             {
00939                   SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
00940                   break;
00941             }
00942 
00943     //
00944             // Once here, no mem flags were given, use default
00945     //
00946 
00947             SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN;
00948 
00949       } while( FALSE );
00950 
00951   //
00952       // Set other, common structure elements
00953   //
00954 
00955   SurfaceDescription.dwSize = sizeof(DDSURFACEDESC);
00956   SurfaceDescription.dwWidth = usWidth;
00957   SurfaceDescription.dwHeight = usHeight;
00958       SurfaceDescription.ddpfPixelFormat = PixelFormat;
00959 
00960   //
00961       // Create Surface
00962   //
00963 
00964       DDCreateSurface ( lpDD2Object, &SurfaceDescription, &lpDDS, &lpDDS2 );
00965 
00966   //
00967       // Allocate memory for Video Surface data and initialize
00968   //
00969 
00970       hVSurface = (HVSURFACE) MemAlloc( sizeof( SGPVSurface ) );
00971       memset( hVSurface, 0, sizeof( SGPVSurface ) );
00972       CHECKF( hVSurface != NULL );
00973 
00974       hVSurface->usHeight                             = usHeight;
00975       hVSurface->usWidth                                    = usWidth;
00976       hVSurface->ubBitDepth                     = ubBitDepth;
00977       hVSurface->pSurfaceData1                  = (PTR)lpDDS;
00978       hVSurface->pSurfaceData             = (PTR)lpDDS2;
00979       hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData1 = NULL;
00980       hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData = NULL;
00981       hVSurface->pPalette                             = NULL;
00982       hVSurface->p16BPPPalette                  = NULL;
00983       hVSurface->TransparentColor   = FROMRGB( 0, 0, 0 );
00984       hVSurface->RegionList                     = CreateList( DEFAULT_NUM_REGIONS, sizeof( VSURFACE_REGION ) );
00985       hVSurface->fFlags                               = 0;
00986       hVSurface->pClipper                             = NULL;
00987 
00988   //
00989       // Determine memory and other attributes of newly created surface
00990   //
00991 
00992       DDGetSurfaceDescription ( lpDDS2, &SurfaceDescription );
00993 
00994   //
00995       // Fail if create tried for video but it's in system
00996   //
00997 
00998       if ( VSurfaceDesc->fCreateFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps & DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY )
00999       {
01000     //
01001             // Return failure due to not in video
01002     //
01003 
01004             DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed to create Video Surface in video memory" ) );
01005             DDReleaseSurface ( &lpDDS, &lpDDS2 );
01006             MemFree( hVSurface );
01007             return( NULL );
01008       }
01009 
01010   //
01011       // Look for system memory
01012   //
01013 
01014       if ( SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps & DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY )
01015       {
01016             hVSurface->fFlags |= VSURFACE_SYSTEM_MEM_USAGE;
01017       }
01018 
01019   //
01020       // Look for video memory
01021   //
01022 
01023       if ( SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps & DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY )
01024       {
01025             hVSurface->fFlags |= VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE;
01026       }
01027 
01028   //
01029       // If in video memory, create backup surface
01030   //
01031 
01032       if ( hVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE )
01033       {
01034             SurfaceDescription.dwFlags = DDSD_CAPS | DDSD_HEIGHT | DDSD_WIDTH | DDSD_PIXELFORMAT;
01035             SurfaceDescription.ddsCaps.dwCaps = DDSCAPS_OFFSCREENPLAIN | DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY;
01036             SurfaceDescription.dwSize = sizeof(DDSURFACEDESC);
01037             SurfaceDescription.dwWidth = usWidth;
01038             SurfaceDescription.dwHeight = usHeight;
01039             SurfaceDescription.ddpfPixelFormat = PixelFormat;
01040 
01041     //
01042             // Create Surface
01043     //
01044 
01045             DDCreateSurface ( lpDD2Object, &SurfaceDescription, &lpDDS, &lpDDS2 );
01046 
01047     //
01048             // Save surface to backup
01049     //
01050 
01051             hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData1 = lpDDS;
01052             hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData = lpDDS2;
01053       }
01054 
01055   //
01056       // Initialize surface with hImage , if given
01057   //
01058 
01059       if ( VSurfaceDesc->fCreateFlags & VSURFACE_CREATE_FROMFILE )
01060       {
01061             tempRect.iLeft = 0;
01062             tempRect.iTop = 0;
01063             tempRect.iRight = hImage->usWidth-1;
01064             tempRect.iBottom = hImage->usHeight-1;
01065             SetVideoSurfaceDataFromHImage( hVSurface, hImage, 0, 0, &tempRect );
01066 
01067     //
01068             // Set palette from himage
01069     //
01070 
01071             if ( hImage->ubBitDepth == 8 )
01072             {
01073                   SetVideoSurfacePalette( hVSurface, hImage->pPalette );
01074             }
01075 
01076     //
01077             // Delete himage object
01078     //
01079 
01080             DestroyImage( hImage );
01081       }
01082 
01083   //
01084       // All is well
01085   //
01086 
01087       hVSurface->usHeight                             = usHeight;
01088       hVSurface->usWidth                                    = usWidth;
01089       hVSurface->ubBitDepth                     = ubBitDepth;
01090 
01091       giMemUsedInSurfaces += ( hVSurface->usHeight * hVSurface->usWidth * ( hVSurface->ubBitDepth / 8 ) );
01092 
01093   DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Success in Creating Video Surface" ) );
01094 
01095       return( hVSurface );
01096 }
01097 
01098 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01099 //
01100 // Called when surface is lost, for the most part called by utility functions
01101 //
01102 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01103 
01104 BOOLEAN RestoreVideoSurface( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01105 {
01106       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2          lpDDSurface;
01107       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2          lpBackupDDSurface;
01108       RECT                                                        aRect;
01109 
01110       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01111 
01112   //
01113       // Restore is only for VIDEO MEMORY - should check if VIDEO and QUIT if not
01114   //
01115 
01116       if ( !( hVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE ) )
01117       {
01118     //
01119             // No second surfaace has been allocated, return failure
01120     //
01121 
01122         DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String("Failed to restore Video Surface surface" ) );
01123             return( FALSE );
01124       }
01125 
01126   //
01127       // Check for valid secondary surface
01128   //
01129 
01130       if ( hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData1 == NULL )
01131       {
01132     //
01133             // No secondary surface available
01134     //
01135 
01136         DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String("Failure in retoring- no secondary surface found" ) );
01137             return( FALSE );
01138       }
01139 
01140       // Restore primary surface
01141       lpDDSurface = ( LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2 )hVSurface->pSurfaceData;
01142       DDRestoreSurface( lpDDSurface );
01143 
01144       // Blit backup surface data into primary
01145       lpBackupDDSurface = ( LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2 )hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData;
01146 
01147       aRect.top = (int)0;
01148       aRect.left = (int)0;
01149       aRect.bottom = (int)hVSurface->usHeight;
01150       aRect.right = (int)hVSurface->usWidth;
01151 
01152       DDBltFastSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData, 0, 0, (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, &aRect, DDBLTFAST_NOCOLORKEY );
01153 
01154       return( TRUE );
01155 }
01156 
01157 
01158 // Lock must be followed by release
01159 // Pitch MUST be used for all width calculations ( Pitch is in bytes )
01160 // The time between Locking and unlocking must be minimal
01161 BYTE *LockVideoSurfaceBuffer( HVSURFACE hVSurface, UINT32 *pPitch )
01162 {
01163       DDSURFACEDESC SurfaceDescription;
01164 
01165       // Assertions
01166       if ( hVSurface == NULL )
01167       {
01168             int i = 0;
01169       }
01170 
01171 
01172       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01173       Assert( pPitch != NULL );
01174 
01175 #ifndef JA2
01176       if(hVSurface==ghFrameBuffer)
01177             return(LockFrameBuffer(pPitch));
01178 #endif
01179 
01180       DDLockSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, NULL, &SurfaceDescription, 0, NULL);
01181 
01182       *pPitch = SurfaceDescription.lPitch;
01183 
01184       return (BYTE *)SurfaceDescription.lpSurface;
01185 }
01186 
01187 void UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01188 {
01189       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01190 
01191 #ifndef JA2
01192       if(hVSurface==ghFrameBuffer)
01193       {
01194             UnlockFrameBuffer();
01195             return;
01196       }
01197 #endif
01198 
01199       DDUnlockSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, NULL );
01200 
01201       // Copy contents if surface is in video
01202       if ( hVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && !(hVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE) )
01203       {
01204             UpdateBackupSurface( hVSurface );
01205       }
01206 }
01207 
01208 // Given an HIMAGE object, blit imagery into existing Video Surface. Can be from 8->16 BPP
01209 BOOLEAN SetVideoSurfaceDataFromHImage( HVSURFACE hVSurface, HIMAGE hImage, UINT16 usX, UINT16 usY, SGPRect *pSrcRect )
01210 {
01211       BYTE        *pDest;
01212       UINT32      fBufferBPP = 0;
01213       UINT32  uiPitch;
01214       UINT16  usEffectiveWidth;
01215       SGPRect     aRect;
01216 
01217       // Assertions
01218       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01219       Assert( hImage != NULL );
01220 
01221       // Get Size of hImage and determine if it can fit
01222       CHECKF( hImage->usWidth  >= hVSurface->usWidth );
01223       CHECKF( hImage->usHeight >= hVSurface->usHeight );
01224 
01225       // Check BPP and see if they are the same
01226       if ( hImage->ubBitDepth != hVSurface->ubBitDepth )
01227       {
01228             // They are not the same, but we can go from 8->16 without much cost
01229             if ( hImage->ubBitDepth == 8 && hVSurface->ubBitDepth == 16 )
01230             {
01231                   fBufferBPP = BUFFER_16BPP;
01232             }
01233       }
01234       else
01235       {
01236             // Set buffer BPP
01237             switch ( hImage->ubBitDepth )
01238             {
01239                   case 8:
01240 
01241                         fBufferBPP = BUFFER_8BPP;
01242                         break;
01243 
01244                   case 16:
01245 
01246                         fBufferBPP = BUFFER_16BPP;
01247                         break;
01248             }
01249 
01250       }
01251 
01252       Assert( fBufferBPP != 0 );
01253 
01254       // Get surface buffer data
01255       pDest = LockVideoSurfaceBuffer( hVSurface, &uiPitch );
01256 
01257       // Effective width ( in PIXELS ) is Pitch ( in bytes ) converted to pitch ( IN PIXELS )
01258       usEffectiveWidth = (UINT16)( uiPitch / ( hVSurface->ubBitDepth / 8 ) );
01259 
01260       CHECKF( pDest != NULL );
01261 
01262       // Blit Surface
01263       // If rect is NULL, use entrie image size
01264       if ( pSrcRect == NULL )
01265       {
01266             aRect.iLeft = 0;
01267             aRect.iTop = 0;
01268             aRect.iRight = hImage->usWidth;
01269             aRect.iBottom = hImage->usHeight;
01270       }
01271       else
01272       {
01273             aRect.iLeft = pSrcRect->iLeft;
01274             aRect.iTop = pSrcRect->iTop;
01275             aRect.iRight = pSrcRect->iRight;
01276             aRect.iBottom = pSrcRect->iBottom;
01277       }
01278 
01279       // This HIMAGE function will transparently copy buffer
01280       if ( !CopyImageToBuffer( hImage, fBufferBPP, pDest, usEffectiveWidth, hVSurface->usHeight, usX, usY, &aRect ) )
01281       {
01282     DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Error Occured Copying HIMAGE to HVSURFACE" ));
01283             UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer( hVSurface );
01284             return( FALSE );
01285       }
01286 
01287       // All is OK
01288       UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer( hVSurface );
01289 
01290       return( TRUE );
01291 
01292 }
01293 
01294 // Palette setting is expensive, need to set both DDPalette and create 16BPP palette
01295 BOOLEAN SetVideoSurfacePalette( HVSURFACE hVSurface, SGPPaletteEntry *pSrcPalette )
01296 {
01297 
01298       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01299 
01300       // Create palette object if not already done so
01301       if ( hVSurface->pPalette == NULL )
01302       {
01303             DDCreatePalette( GetDirectDraw2Object(), (DDPCAPS_8BIT | DDPCAPS_ALLOW256), (LPPALETTEENTRY)(&pSrcPalette[0]), (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE*)&(hVSurface->pPalette), NULL);
01304 
01305             // Set into surface
01306             //DDSetSurfacePalette( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE)hVSurface->pPalette );
01307 
01308       }
01309       else
01310       {
01311             // Just Change entries
01312             DDSetPaletteEntries( (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE)hVSurface->pPalette, 0, 0, 256, ( PALETTEENTRY*)pSrcPalette );
01313       }
01314 
01315       // Delete 16BPP Palette if one exists
01316       if ( hVSurface->p16BPPPalette != NULL )
01317       {
01318             MemFree( hVSurface->p16BPPPalette );
01319             hVSurface->p16BPPPalette = NULL;
01320       }
01321 
01322       // Create 16BPP Palette
01323       hVSurface->p16BPPPalette = Create16BPPPalette( pSrcPalette );
01324 
01325   DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_3, String("Video Surface Palette change successfull" ));
01326       return( TRUE );
01327 }
01328 
01329 // Transparency needs to take RGB value and find best fit and place it into DD Surface
01330 // colorkey value.
01331 BOOLEAN SetVideoSurfaceTransparencyColor( HVSURFACE hVSurface, COLORVAL TransColor )
01332 {
01333   DDCOLORKEY            ColorKey;
01334   DWORD                             fFlags = CLR_INVALID;
01335       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2    lpDDSurface;
01336 
01337       // Assertions
01338       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01339 
01340       //Set trans color into Video Surface
01341       hVSurface->TransparentColor = TransColor;
01342 
01343       // Get surface pointer
01344       lpDDSurface = (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData;
01345       CHECKF( lpDDSurface != NULL );
01346 
01347       // Get right pixel format, based on bit depth
01348 
01349       switch( hVSurface->ubBitDepth )
01350       {
01351                   case 8:
01352 
01353                         // Use color directly
01354                         ColorKey.dwColorSpaceLowValue  = TransColor;
01355                         ColorKey.dwColorSpaceHighValue = TransColor;
01356                         break;
01357 
01358                   case 16:
01359 
01360                         fFlags = Get16BPPColor( TransColor );
01361 
01362                         //fFlags now contains our closest match
01363                         ColorKey.dwColorSpaceLowValue  = fFlags;
01364                         ColorKey.dwColorSpaceHighValue = ColorKey.dwColorSpaceLowValue;
01365                         break;
01366 
01367       }
01368 
01369       DDSetSurfaceColorKey( lpDDSurface, DDCKEY_SRCBLT, &ColorKey);
01370 
01371       return( TRUE );
01372 }
01373 
01374 
01375 BOOLEAN GetVSurfacePaletteEntries( HVSURFACE hVSurface, SGPPaletteEntry *pPalette )
01376 {
01377       CHECKF( hVSurface->pPalette != NULL );
01378 
01379       DDGetPaletteEntries( (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE)hVSurface->pPalette, 0, 0, 256, (PALETTEENTRY*)pPalette );
01380 
01381       return( TRUE );
01382 }
01383 
01384 
01385 BOOLEAN DeleteVideoSurfaceFromIndex( UINT32 uiIndex )
01386 {
01387       VSURFACE_NODE *curr;
01388 
01389       #ifdef _DEBUG
01390             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_DELETEVIDEOSURFACEFROMINDEX;
01391             CheckValidVSurfaceIndex( uiIndex );
01392       #endif
01393 
01394       curr = gpVSurfaceHead;
01395       while( curr )
01396       {
01397             if( curr->uiIndex == uiIndex )
01398             { //Found the node, so detach it and delete it.
01399 
01400                   //Deallocate the memory for the video surface
01401                   DeleteVideoSurface( curr->hVSurface );
01402 
01403                   if( curr == gpVSurfaceHead )
01404                   { //Advance the head, because we are going to remove the head node.
01405                         gpVSurfaceHead = gpVSurfaceHead->next;
01406                   }
01407                   if( curr == gpVSurfaceTail )
01408                   { //Back up the tail, because we are going to remove the tail node.
01409                         gpVSurfaceTail = gpVSurfaceTail->prev;
01410                   }
01411                   //Detach the node from the vsurface list
01412                   if( curr->next )
01413                   { //Make the prev node point to the next
01414                         curr->next->prev = curr->prev;
01415                   }
01416                   if( curr->prev )
01417                   { //Make the next node point to the prev
01418                         curr->prev->next = curr->next;
01419                   }
01420                   //The node is now detached.  Now deallocate it.
01421 
01422                   #ifdef SGP_VIDEO_DEBUGGING
01423                         if( curr->pName )
01424                         {
01425                               MemFree( curr->pName );
01426                         }
01427                         if( curr->pCode )
01428                         {
01429                               MemFree( curr->pCode );
01430                         }
01431                   #endif
01432 
01433                   MemFree( curr );
01434                   guiVSurfaceSize--;
01435                   return TRUE;
01436             }
01437             curr = curr->next;
01438       }
01439       return FALSE;
01440 }
01441 
01442 
01443 // Deletes all palettes, surfaces and region data
01444 BOOLEAN DeleteVideoSurface( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01445 {
01446       LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2    lpDDSurface;
01447 
01448       // Assertions
01449       CHECKF( hVSurface != NULL );
01450 
01451       // Release palette
01452       if ( hVSurface->pPalette != NULL )
01453       {
01454             DDReleasePalette( (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE)hVSurface->pPalette );
01455             hVSurface->pPalette = NULL;
01456       }
01457 
01458       //if ( hVSurface->pClipper != NULL )
01459       //{
01460             // Release Clipper
01461       //    DDReleaseClipper( (LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER)hVSurface->pClipper );
01462       //}
01463 
01464       // Get surface pointer
01465       lpDDSurface = (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData;
01466 
01467       // Release surface
01468       if ( hVSurface->pSurfaceData1 != NULL )
01469       {
01470             DDReleaseSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE*)&hVSurface->pSurfaceData1, &lpDDSurface );
01471       }
01472 
01473       // Release backup surface
01474       if ( hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData != NULL )
01475       {
01476             DDReleaseSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE*)&hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData1,
01477                                                 (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2*)&hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData );
01478       }
01479 
01480       // Release region data
01481       DeleteList( hVSurface->RegionList );
01482 
01483       //If there is a 16bpp palette, free it
01484       if( hVSurface->p16BPPPalette != NULL )
01485       {
01486             MemFree( hVSurface->p16BPPPalette );
01487             hVSurface->p16BPPPalette = NULL;
01488       }
01489 
01490       giMemUsedInSurfaces -= ( hVSurface->usHeight * hVSurface->usWidth * ( hVSurface->ubBitDepth / 8 ) );
01491 
01492       // Release object
01493       MemFree( hVSurface );
01494 
01495       return( TRUE );
01496 }
01497 
01498 // ********************************************************
01499 //
01500 // Clipper manipulation functions
01501 //
01502 // ********************************************************
01503 
01504 BOOLEAN SetClipList( HVSURFACE hVSurface, SGPRect *RegionData, UINT16 usNumRegions )
01505 {
01506       RGNDATA                                         *pRgnData;
01507       UINT16                                          cnt;
01508       RECT                                            aRect;
01509       LPDIRECTDRAW2                       lpDD2Object;
01510 
01511       // Get Direct Draw Object
01512       lpDD2Object = GetDirectDraw2Object( );
01513 
01514       // Assertions
01515       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01516       Assert( RegionData != NULL );
01517 
01518       // Varifications
01519       CHECKF( usNumRegions > 0 );
01520 
01521       // If Clipper already created, release
01522       if ( hVSurface->pClipper != NULL )
01523       {
01524             // Release Clipper
01525             DDReleaseClipper( (LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER)hVSurface->pClipper );
01526       }
01527 
01528       // Create Clipper Object
01529       DDCreateClipper( lpDD2Object, 0, (LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER*)&(hVSurface->pClipper) );
01530 
01531       // Allocate region data
01532       pRgnData = ( LPRGNDATA )MemAlloc( sizeof( RGNDATAHEADER) + ( usNumRegions * sizeof( RECT ) ) );
01533       CHECKF( pRgnData );
01534 
01535       // Setup header
01536       pRgnData->rdh.dwSize = sizeof( RGNDATA );
01537       pRgnData->rdh.iType = RDH_RECTANGLES;
01538       pRgnData->rdh.nCount = usNumRegions;
01539       pRgnData->rdh.nRgnSize = usNumRegions * sizeof( RECT );
01540       pRgnData->rdh.rcBound.top  = 0;
01541       pRgnData->rdh.rcBound.left  = 0;
01542       pRgnData->rdh.rcBound.bottom  = (int)hVSurface->usHeight;
01543       pRgnData->rdh.rcBound.right = (int)hVSurface->usWidth;
01544 
01545       // Copy rectangles into region
01546       for ( cnt = 0; cnt < usNumRegions; cnt++ )
01547       {
01548             aRect.top = (UINT32)RegionData[ cnt ].iTop;
01549             aRect.left = (UINT32)RegionData[ cnt ].iLeft;
01550             aRect.bottom = (UINT32)RegionData[ cnt ].iBottom;
01551             aRect.right = (UINT32)RegionData[ cnt ].iRight;
01552 
01553             memcpy( pRgnData + sizeof( RGNDATAHEADER) + ( cnt * sizeof( RECT ) ), &aRect, sizeof( RECT ) );
01554       }
01555 
01556       // Set items into clipper
01557       DDSetClipperList( (LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER)hVSurface->pClipper, pRgnData, 0 );
01558 
01559       // Set Clipper into Surface
01560       DDSetClipper( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, (LPDIRECTDRAWCLIPPER)hVSurface->pClipper );
01561 
01562       // Delete region data
01563       MemFree( pRgnData );
01564 
01565       return( TRUE );
01566 }
01567

01575 BOOLEAN GetNumRegions( HVSURFACE hVSurface , UINT32 *puiNumRegions )
01576 {

01580 
01581       return( TRUE );
01582 
01583 }

01585 BOOLEAN AddVSurfaceRegion( HVSURFACE hVSurface, VSURFACE_REGION *pNewRegion )
01586 {
01587       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01588       Assert( pNewRegion != NULL );
01589 
01590       // Add new region to list
01591       hVSurface->RegionList = AddtoList( hVSurface->RegionList, pNewRegion, ListSize( hVSurface->RegionList ) );
01592 
01593       return( TRUE );
01594 }
01595 
01596 // Add a group of regions
01597 BOOLEAN AddVSurfaceRegions( HVSURFACE hVSurface, VSURFACE_REGION **ppNewRegions, UINT16 uiNumRegions )
01598 {
01599       UINT16 cnt;
01600 
01601       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01602       Assert( ppNewRegions != NULL );
01603 
01604       for ( cnt = 0; cnt < uiNumRegions; cnt++ )
01605       {
01606             AddVSurfaceRegion( hVSurface, ppNewRegions[ cnt ] );
01607       }
01608 
01609       return( TRUE );
01610 }

01612 BOOLEAN RemoveVSurfaceRegion( HVSURFACE hVSurface, UINT16 usIndex )
01613 {
01614       VSURFACE_REGION   aRegion;
01615 
01616       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01617 
01618       return( RemfromList( hVSurface->RegionList, &aRegion, usIndex ) );
01619 
01620 }
01621 
01622 BOOLEAN ClearAllVSurfaceRegions( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01623 {
01624       UINT32 uiListSize, cnt;
01625 
01626       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01627 
01628       uiListSize = ListSize( hVSurface->RegionList );
01629 
01630       for ( cnt = uiListSize - 1; cnt >= 0; cnt-- )
01631       {
01632             RemoveVSurfaceRegion( hVSurface, (UINT16)cnt );
01633       }
01634 
01635       return( TRUE );
01636 }
01637 
01638 BOOLEAN GetVSurfaceRegion( HVSURFACE hVSurface, UINT16 usIndex, VSURFACE_REGION *aRegion )
01639 {
01640       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01641 
01642       if ( !PeekList( hVSurface->RegionList, aRegion, usIndex ) )
01643       {
01644             return( FALSE );
01645       }
01646 
01647       return( TRUE );
01648 }
01649 
01650 BOOLEAN GetVSurfaceRect( HVSURFACE hVSurface, RECT *pRect)
01651 {
01652       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01653       Assert( pRect != NULL );
01654 
01655       pRect->left=0;
01656       pRect->top=0;
01657       pRect->right=hVSurface->usWidth;
01658       pRect->bottom=hVSurface->usHeight;
01659 
01660       return( TRUE );
01661 }
01662 
01663 BOOLEAN ReplaceVSurfaceRegion( HVSURFACE hVSurface , UINT16 usIndex, VSURFACE_REGION *aRegion )
01664 {
01665       VSURFACE_REGION OldRegion;
01666 
01667       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01668 
01669       // Validate index given
01670       if ( !PeekList( hVSurface->RegionList, &OldRegion, usIndex ) )
01671       {
01672             return( FALSE );
01673       }
01674 
01675       // Replace information
01676       hVSurface->RegionList = AddtoList( hVSurface->RegionList, aRegion, usIndex );
01677 
01678       return( TRUE );
01679 }
01680 
01681 BOOLEAN AddVSurfaceRegionAtIndex( HVSURFACE hVSurface, UINT16 usIndex, VSURFACE_REGION *pNewRegion )
01682 {
01683       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01684       Assert( pNewRegion != NULL );
01685 
01686       // Add new region to list
01687       hVSurface->RegionList = AddtoList( hVSurface->RegionList, pNewRegion, usIndex );
01688 
01689       return( TRUE );
01690 
01691 }
01692 
01693 // *******************************************************************
01694 //
01695 // Blitting Functions
01696 //
01697 // *******************************************************************
01698 
01699 // Blt  will use DD Blt or BltFast depending on flags.
01700 // Will drop down into user-defined blitter if 8->16 BPP blitting is being done
01701 
01702 BOOLEAN BltVideoSurfaceToVideoSurface( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, HVSURFACE hSrcVSurface, UINT16 usIndex, INT32 iDestX, INT32 iDestY, INT32 fBltFlags, blt_vs_fx *pBltFx )
01703 {
01704       VSURFACE_REGION aRegion;
01705       RECT                           SrcRect, DestRect;
01706       UINT8                         *pSrcSurface8, *pDestSurface8;
01707       UINT16                        *pDestSurface16, *pSrcSurface16;
01708       UINT32                        uiSrcPitch, uiDestPitch, uiWidth, uiHeight;
01709 
01710       // Assertions
01711       Assert( hDestVSurface != NULL );
01712 
01713       // Check that both region and subrect are not given
01714       if ((fBltFlags&VS_BLT_SRCREGION) && (fBltFlags&VS_BLT_SRCSUBRECT))
01715       {
01716                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Inconsistant blit flags given" ));
01717                   return( FALSE );
01718       }
01719 
01720       // Check for dest src options
01721       if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_DESTREGION )
01722       {
01723                   CHECKF( pBltFx != NULL );
01724                   CHECKF( GetVSurfaceRegion( hDestVSurface, pBltFx->DestRegion, &aRegion ) );
01725 
01726                   // Set starting coordinates from destination region
01727                   iDestY = aRegion.RegionCoords.iTop;
01728                   iDestX = aRegion.RegionCoords.iLeft;
01729       }
01730 
01731       // Check for fill, if true, fill entire region with color
01732       if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_COLORFILL )
01733       {
01734             return( FillSurface( hDestVSurface, pBltFx ) );
01735       }
01736 
01737       // Check for colorfill rectangle
01738       if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_COLORFILLRECT )
01739       {
01740             return( FillSurfaceRect( hDestVSurface, pBltFx ) );
01741       }
01742 
01743       // Check for source coordinate options - from region, specific rect or full src dimensions
01744       do
01745       {
01746             // Get Region from index, if specified
01747             if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_SRCREGION )
01748             {
01749                   CHECKF( GetVSurfaceRegion( hSrcVSurface, usIndex, &aRegion ) )
01750 
01751                   SrcRect.top = (int)aRegion.RegionCoords.iTop;
01752                   SrcRect.left = (int)aRegion.RegionCoords.iLeft;
01753                   SrcRect.bottom = (int)aRegion.RegionCoords.iBottom;
01754                   SrcRect.right = (int)aRegion.RegionCoords.iRight;
01755                   break;
01756             }
01757 
01758             // Use SUBRECT if specified
01759             if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_SRCSUBRECT )
01760             {
01761                   SGPRect aSubRect;
01762 
01763                   CHECKF( pBltFx != NULL );
01764 
01765                   aSubRect = pBltFx->SrcRect;
01766 
01767                   SrcRect.top = (int)aSubRect.iTop;
01768                   SrcRect.left = (int)aSubRect.iLeft;
01769                   SrcRect.bottom = (int)aSubRect.iBottom;
01770                   SrcRect.right = (int)aSubRect.iRight;
01771 
01772                   break;
01773             }
01774 
01775             // Here, use default, which is entire Video Surface
01776             // Check Sizes, SRC size MUST be <= DEST size
01777             if ( hDestVSurface->usHeight < hSrcVSurface->usHeight )
01778             {
01779                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Incompatible height size given in Video Surface blit" ));
01780                         return( FALSE );
01781             }
01782             if ( hDestVSurface->usWidth < hSrcVSurface->usWidth )
01783             {
01784                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Incompatible height size given in Video Surface blit" ));
01785                         return( FALSE );
01786             }
01787 
01788             SrcRect.top = (int)0;
01789             SrcRect.left = (int)0;
01790             SrcRect.bottom = (int)hSrcVSurface->usHeight;
01791             SrcRect.right = (int)hSrcVSurface->usWidth;
01792 
01793       } while( FALSE );
01794 
01795       // Once here, assert valid Src
01796       Assert( hSrcVSurface != NULL );
01797 
01798       // clipping -- added by DB
01799       GetVSurfaceRect( hDestVSurface, &DestRect);
01800       uiWidth=SrcRect.right-SrcRect.left;
01801       uiHeight=SrcRect.bottom-SrcRect.top;
01802 
01803       // check for position entirely off the screen
01804       if(iDestX >= DestRect.right)
01805             return(FALSE);
01806       if(iDestY >= DestRect.bottom)
01807             return(FALSE);
01808       if((iDestX+(INT32)uiWidth) < (INT32)DestRect.left)
01809             return(FALSE);
01810       if((iDestY+(INT32)uiHeight) < (INT32)DestRect.top)
01811             return(FALSE);
01812 
01813       // DB The mirroring stuff has to do it's own clipping because
01814       // it needs to invert some of the numbers
01815       if(!(fBltFlags & VS_BLT_MIRROR_Y))
01816       {
01817             if((iDestX+(INT32)uiWidth) >= (INT32)DestRect.right)
01818             {
01819                   SrcRect.right-=((iDestX+uiWidth)-DestRect.right);
01820                   uiWidth-=((iDestX+uiWidth)-DestRect.right);
01821             }
01822             if((iDestY+(INT32)uiHeight) >= (INT32)DestRect.bottom)
01823             {
01824                   SrcRect.bottom-=((iDestY+uiHeight)-DestRect.bottom);
01825                   uiHeight-=((iDestY+uiHeight)-DestRect.bottom);
01826             }
01827             if(iDestX < DestRect.left)
01828             {
01829                   SrcRect.left+=(DestRect.left-iDestX);
01830                   uiWidth-=(DestRect.left-iDestX);
01831                   iDestX=DestRect.left;
01832             }
01833             if(iDestY < (INT32)DestRect.top)
01834             {
01835                   SrcRect.top+=(DestRect.top-iDestY);
01836                   uiHeight-=(DestRect.top-iDestY);
01837                   iDestY=DestRect.top;
01838             }
01839       }
01840 
01841       // Send dest position, rectangle, etc to DD bltfast function
01842       // First check BPP values for compatibility
01843       if ( hDestVSurface->ubBitDepth == 16 && hSrcVSurface->ubBitDepth == 16 )
01844       {
01845             if(fBltFlags & VS_BLT_MIRROR_Y)
01846             {
01847                   if((pSrcSurface16=(UINT16 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface, &uiSrcPitch))==NULL)
01848                   {
01849                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 16BPP surface for blitting" ));
01850                         return(FALSE);
01851                   }
01852 
01853                   if((pDestSurface16=(UINT16 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface, &uiDestPitch))==NULL)
01854                   {
01855                         UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01856                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 16BPP dest surface for blitting" ));
01857                         return(FALSE);
01858                   }
01859 
01860                   Blt16BPPTo16BPPMirror(pDestSurface16, uiDestPitch, pSrcSurface16, uiSrcPitch, iDestX, iDestY, SrcRect.left, SrcRect.top, uiWidth, uiHeight);
01861                   UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01862                   UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface);
01863                   return(TRUE);
01864             }
01865 // For testing with non-DDraw blitting, uncomment to test -- DB
01866 #ifndef JA2
01867             else
01868             {
01869                   if((pSrcSurface16=(UINT16 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface, &uiSrcPitch))==NULL)
01870                   {
01871                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 16BPP surface for blitting" ));
01872                         return(FALSE);
01873                   }
01874 
01875                   if((pDestSurface16=(UINT16 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface, &uiDestPitch))==NULL)
01876                   {
01877                         UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01878                         DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 16BPP dest surface for blitting" ));
01879                         return(FALSE);
01880                   }
01881 
01882                   Blt16BPPTo16BPP(pDestSurface16, uiDestPitch, pSrcSurface16, uiSrcPitch, iDestX, iDestY, SrcRect.left, SrcRect.top, uiWidth, uiHeight);
01883                   UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01884                   UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface);
01885                   return(TRUE);
01886             }
01887 #endif
01888 
01889             CHECKF( BltVSurfaceUsingDD( hDestVSurface, hSrcVSurface, fBltFlags, iDestX, iDestY, &SrcRect ) );
01890 
01891       }
01892       else if ( hDestVSurface->ubBitDepth == 8 && hSrcVSurface->ubBitDepth == 8 )
01893       {
01894             if((pSrcSurface8=(UINT8 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface, &uiSrcPitch))==NULL)
01895             {
01896                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 8BPP surface for blitting" ));
01897                   return(FALSE);
01898             }
01899 
01900             if((pDestSurface8=(UINT8 *)LockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface, &uiDestPitch))==NULL)
01901             {
01902                   UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01903                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Failed on lock of 8BPP dest surface for blitting" ));
01904                   return(FALSE);
01905             }
01906 
01907             //Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBuffer( UINT8 *pBuffer, UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES, HVOBJECT hSrcVObject, INT32 iX, INT32 iY, UINT16 usIndex );
01908             Blt8BPPTo8BPP(pDestSurface8, uiDestPitch, pSrcSurface8, uiSrcPitch, iDestX, iDestY, SrcRect.left, SrcRect.top, uiWidth, uiHeight);
01909             UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hSrcVSurface);
01910             UnLockVideoSurfaceBuffer(hDestVSurface);
01911             return(TRUE);
01912       }
01913       else
01914       {
01915             DbgMessage(TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_2, String( "Incompatible BPP values with src and dest Video Surfaces for blitting" ));
01916             return( FALSE );
01917       }
01918 
01919       return( TRUE );
01920 }
01921 
01922 
01923 
01924 // ******************************************************************************************
01925 //
01926 // UTILITY FUNCTIONS
01927 //
01928 // ******************************************************************************************
01929 
01930 // Blt to backup buffer
01931 BOOLEAN UpdateBackupSurface( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01932 {
01933       RECT        aRect;
01934 
01935       // Assertions
01936       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01937 
01938       // Validations
01939       CHECKF( hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData != NULL );
01940 
01941       aRect.top = (int)0;
01942       aRect.left = (int)0;
01943       aRect.bottom = (int)hVSurface->usHeight;
01944       aRect.right = (int)hVSurface->usWidth;
01945 
01946       // Copy all contents into backup buffer
01947       DDBltFastSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSurfaceData, 0, 0, (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData, &aRect, DDBLTFAST_NOCOLORKEY );
01948 
01949       return( TRUE );
01950 
01951 }

01959 
01960 LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2 GetVideoSurfaceDDSurface( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01961 {
01962       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01963 
01964       return( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2) hVSurface->pSurfaceData );
01965 }
01966 
01967 LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE GetVideoSurfaceDDSurfaceOne( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01968 {
01969       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01970 
01971       return( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE) hVSurface->pSurfaceData1 );
01972 }
01973 
01974 
01975 LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE  GetVideoSurfaceDDPalette( HVSURFACE hVSurface )
01976 {
01977       Assert( hVSurface != NULL );
01978 
01979       return( (LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE) hVSurface->pPalette );
01980 }
01981 
01982 HVSURFACE CreateVideoSurfaceFromDDSurface( LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2 lpDDSurface )
01983 {
01984       // Create Video Surface
01985       DDPIXELFORMAT                   PixelFormat;
01986       HVSURFACE                                 hVSurface;
01987       DDSURFACEDESC                   DDSurfaceDesc;
01988       LPDIRECTDRAWPALETTE     pDDPalette;
01989       SGPPaletteEntry               SGPPalette[ 256 ];
01990       HRESULT                                         ReturnCode;
01991 
01992 
01993       // Allocate Video Surface struct
01994       hVSurface = (HVSURFACE) MemAlloc( sizeof( SGPVSurface ) );
01995 
01996       // Set values based on DD Surface given
01997       DDGetSurfaceDescription ( lpDDSurface, &DDSurfaceDesc );
01998       PixelFormat = DDSurfaceDesc.ddpfPixelFormat;
01999 
02000       hVSurface->usHeight                             = (UINT16)DDSurfaceDesc.dwHeight;
02001       hVSurface->usWidth                                    = (UINT16)DDSurfaceDesc.dwWidth;
02002       hVSurface->ubBitDepth                     = (UINT8)PixelFormat.dwRGBBitCount;
02003       hVSurface->pSurfaceData             = (PTR)lpDDSurface;
02004       hVSurface->pSurfaceData1            = NULL;
02005       hVSurface->pSavedSurfaceData = NULL;
02006       hVSurface->RegionList                     = CreateList( DEFAULT_NUM_REGIONS, sizeof( VSURFACE_REGION ) );
02007       hVSurface->fFlags                               = 0;
02008 
02009       // Get and Set palette, if attached, allow to fail
02010       ReturnCode = IDirectDrawSurface2_GetPalette( lpDDSurface, &pDDPalette );
02011 
02012       if ( ReturnCode == DD_OK )
02013       {
02014             // Set 8-bit Palette and 16 BPP palette
02015             hVSurface->pPalette = pDDPalette;
02016 
02017             // Create 16-BPP Palette
02018             DDGetPaletteEntries( pDDPalette, 0, 0, 256, ( LPPALETTEENTRY )SGPPalette );
02019             hVSurface->p16BPPPalette = Create16BPPPalette( SGPPalette );
02020       }
02021       else
02022       {
02023             hVSurface->pPalette = NULL;
02024             hVSurface->p16BPPPalette = NULL;
02025       }
02026       // Set meory flags
02027       if ( DDSurfaceDesc.ddsCaps.dwCaps & DDSCAPS_SYSTEMMEMORY )
02028       {
02029             hVSurface->fFlags |= VSURFACE_SYSTEM_MEM_USAGE;
02030       }
02031 
02032       if ( DDSurfaceDesc.ddsCaps.dwCaps & DDSCAPS_VIDEOMEMORY )
02033       {
02034             hVSurface->fFlags |= VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE;
02035       }
02036 
02037       // All is well
02038   DbgMessage( TOPIC_VIDEOSURFACE, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Success in Creating Video Surface from DD Surface" ) );
02039 
02040       return( hVSurface );
02041 }

02063 
02064 // UTILITY FUNCTIONS FOR BLITTING
02065 
02066 BOOLEAN ClipReleatedSrcAndDestRectangles( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, HVSURFACE hSrcVSurface, RECT *DestRect, RECT *SrcRect )
02067 {
02068 
02069       Assert( hDestVSurface != NULL );
02070       Assert( hSrcVSurface != NULL );
02071 
02072       // Check for invalid start positions and clip by ignoring blit
02073       if ( DestRect->left >= hDestVSurface->usWidth || DestRect->top >= hDestVSurface->usHeight )
02074       {
02075             return( FALSE );
02076       }
02077 
02078       if ( SrcRect->left >= hSrcVSurface->usWidth || SrcRect->top >= hSrcVSurface->usHeight )
02079       {
02080             return( FALSE );
02081       }
02082 
02083       // For overruns
02084       // Clip destination rectangles
02085       if ( DestRect->right > hDestVSurface->usWidth )
02086       {
02087             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02088             DestRect->right = hDestVSurface->usWidth;
02089             SrcRect->right = SrcRect->left + ( DestRect->right - DestRect->left );
02090       }
02091       if ( DestRect->bottom > hDestVSurface->usHeight )
02092       {
02093             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02094             DestRect->bottom = hDestVSurface->usHeight;
02095             SrcRect->bottom = SrcRect->top + ( DestRect->bottom - DestRect->top );
02096       }
02097 
02098       // Clip src rectangles
02099       if ( SrcRect->right > hSrcVSurface->usWidth )
02100       {
02101             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02102             SrcRect->right = hSrcVSurface->usWidth;
02103             DestRect->right = DestRect->left  + ( SrcRect->right - SrcRect->left );
02104       }
02105       if ( SrcRect->bottom > hSrcVSurface->usHeight )
02106       {
02107             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02108             SrcRect->bottom = hSrcVSurface->usHeight;
02109             DestRect->bottom = DestRect->top + ( SrcRect->bottom - SrcRect->top );
02110       }
02111 
02112       // For underruns
02113       // Clip destination rectangles
02114       if ( DestRect->left < 0 )
02115       {
02116             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02117             DestRect->left = 0;
02118             SrcRect->left = SrcRect->right - ( DestRect->right - DestRect->left );
02119       }
02120       if ( DestRect->top < 0 )
02121       {
02122             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02123             DestRect->top = 0;
02124             SrcRect->top = SrcRect->bottom - ( DestRect->bottom - DestRect->top );
02125       }
02126 
02127       // Clip src rectangles
02128       if ( SrcRect->left < 0 )
02129       {
02130             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02131             SrcRect->left = 0;
02132             DestRect->left = DestRect->right  - ( SrcRect->right - SrcRect->left );
02133       }
02134       if ( SrcRect->top < 0 )
02135       {
02136             // Both have to be modified or by default streching occurs
02137             SrcRect->top = 0;
02138             DestRect->top = DestRect->bottom - ( SrcRect->bottom - SrcRect->top );
02139       }
02140 
02141       return( TRUE );
02142 }
02143 
02144 
02145 BOOLEAN FillSurface( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, blt_vs_fx *pBltFx )
02146 {
02147       DDBLTFX                        BlitterFX;
02148 
02149       Assert( hDestVSurface != NULL );
02150       CHECKF( pBltFx != NULL );
02151 
02152       BlitterFX.dwSize = sizeof( DDBLTFX );
02153       BlitterFX.dwFillColor = pBltFx->ColorFill;
02154 
02155       DDBltSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hDestVSurface->pSurfaceData, NULL, NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL, &BlitterFX );
02156 
02157       if ( hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && !(hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE) )
02158       {
02159             UpdateBackupSurface( hDestVSurface );
02160       }
02161 
02162       return( TRUE );
02163 }
02164 
02165 BOOLEAN FillSurfaceRect( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, blt_vs_fx *pBltFx )
02166 {
02167       DDBLTFX                        BlitterFX;
02168 
02169       Assert( hDestVSurface != NULL );
02170       CHECKF( pBltFx != NULL );
02171 
02172       BlitterFX.dwSize = sizeof( DDBLTFX );
02173       BlitterFX.dwFillColor = pBltFx->ColorFill;
02174 
02175       DDBltSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hDestVSurface->pSurfaceData, (LPRECT)&(pBltFx->FillRect), NULL, NULL, DDBLT_COLORFILL, &BlitterFX );
02176 
02177       if ( hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && !(hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE) )
02178       {
02179             UpdateBackupSurface( hDestVSurface );
02180       }
02181 
02182       return( TRUE );
02183 }
02184 
02185 
02186 BOOLEAN BltVSurfaceUsingDD( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, HVSURFACE hSrcVSurface, UINT32 fBltFlags, INT32 iDestX, INT32 iDestY, RECT *SrcRect )
02187 {
02188       UINT32            uiDDFlags;
02189       RECT              DestRect;
02190 
02191   // Blit using the correct blitter
02192       if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_FAST )
02193       {
02194 
02195             // Validations
02196             CHECKF( iDestX >= 0 );
02197             CHECKF( iDestY >= 0 );
02198 
02199             // Default flags
02200             uiDDFlags = 0;
02201 
02202             // Convert flags into DD flags, ( for transparency use, etc )
02203             if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_USECOLORKEY )
02204             {
02205                   uiDDFlags |= DDBLTFAST_SRCCOLORKEY;
02206             }
02207 
02208             // Convert flags into DD flags, ( for transparency use, etc )
02209             if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_USEDESTCOLORKEY )
02210             {
02211                   uiDDFlags |= DDBLTFAST_DESTCOLORKEY;
02212             }
02213 
02214             if ( uiDDFlags == 0 )
02215             {
02216                   // Default here is no colorkey
02217                   uiDDFlags = DDBLTFAST_NOCOLORKEY;
02218             }
02219 
02220             DDBltFastSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hDestVSurface->pSurfaceData, iDestX, iDestY, (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hSrcVSurface->pSurfaceData, SrcRect, uiDDFlags );
02221 
02222       }
02223       else
02224       {
02225             // Normal, specialized blit for clipping, etc
02226 
02227             // Default flags
02228             uiDDFlags = DDBLT_WAIT;
02229 
02230             // Convert flags into DD flags, ( for transparency use, etc )
02231             if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_USECOLORKEY )
02232             {
02233                   uiDDFlags |= DDBLT_KEYSRC;
02234             }
02235 
02236             // Setup dest rectangle
02237             DestRect.top =  (int)iDestY;
02238             DestRect.left = (int)iDestX;
02239             DestRect.bottom = (int)iDestY + ( SrcRect->bottom - SrcRect->top );
02240             DestRect.right = (int)iDestX + ( SrcRect->right - SrcRect->left );
02241 
02242             // Do Clipping of rectangles
02243             if ( !ClipReleatedSrcAndDestRectangles( hDestVSurface, hSrcVSurface, &DestRect, SrcRect ) )
02244             {
02245                   // Returns false because dest start is > dest size
02246                   return( TRUE );
02247             }
02248 
02249             // Check values for 0 size
02250             if ( DestRect.top == DestRect.bottom || DestRect.right == DestRect.left )
02251             {
02252                   return( TRUE );
02253             }
02254 
02255             // Check for -ve values
02256 
02257 
02258 
02259             DDBltSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hDestVSurface->pSurfaceData, &DestRect, (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hSrcVSurface->pSurfaceData,
02260                                           SrcRect, uiDDFlags, NULL );
02261 
02262       }
02263 
02264       // Update backup surface with new data
02265       if ( hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && !(hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE) )
02266       {
02267             UpdateBackupSurface( hDestVSurface );
02268       }
02269 
02270       return( TRUE );
02271 }

02273 BOOLEAN Blt16BPPBufferShadowRectAlternateTable(UINT16 *pBuffer, UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES, SGPRect *area);
02274 
02275 
02276 
02277 BOOLEAN InternalShadowVideoSurfaceRect(  UINT32 uiDestVSurface, INT32 X1, INT32 Y1, INT32 X2, INT32 Y2, BOOLEAN fLowPercentShadeTable )
02278 {
02279       UINT16 *pBuffer;
02280       UINT32 uiPitch;
02281       SGPRect   area;
02282       HVSURFACE hVSurface;
02283 
02284 
02285       // CLIP IT!
02286       // FIRST GET SURFACE
02287 
02288   //
02289       // Get Video Surface
02290   //
02291       #ifdef _DEBUG
02292             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_SHADOWVIDEOSURFACERECT;
02293       #endif
02294       CHECKF( GetVideoSurface( &hVSurface, uiDestVSurface ) );
02295 
02296       if ( X1 < 0 )
02297                   X1 = 0;
02298 
02299       if ( X2 < 0 )
02300                   return( FALSE );
02301 
02302       if ( Y2 < 0 )
02303                   return( FALSE );
02304 
02305       if ( Y1 < 0 )
02306                   Y1 = 0;
02307 
02308       if ( X2 >= hVSurface->usWidth )
02309                   X2 = hVSurface->usWidth-1;
02310 
02311       if ( Y2 >= hVSurface->usHeight )
02312                   Y2 = hVSurface->usHeight-1;
02313 
02314       if ( X1 >= hVSurface->usWidth )
02315                   return( FALSE );
02316 
02317       if ( Y1 >= hVSurface->usHeight )
02318                   return( FALSE );
02319 
02320       if (  ( X2 - X1 ) <= 0 )
02321                   return( FALSE );
02322 
02323       if (  ( Y2 - Y1 ) <= 0 )
02324                   return( FALSE );
02325 
02326 
02327       area.iTop=Y1;
02328       area.iBottom=Y2;
02329       area.iLeft=X1;
02330       area.iRight=X2;
02331 
02332 
02333       // Lock video surface
02334       pBuffer = (UINT16*)LockVideoSurface( uiDestVSurface, &uiPitch );
02335       //UnLockVideoSurface( uiDestVSurface );
02336 
02337       if ( pBuffer == NULL )
02338       {
02339             return( FALSE );
02340       }
02341 
02342       if ( !fLowPercentShadeTable )
02343       {
02344             // Now we have the video object and surface, call the shadow function
02345             if(!Blt16BPPBufferShadowRect(pBuffer, uiPitch, &area))
02346             {
02347                   // Blit has failed if false returned
02348                   return( FALSE );
02349             }
02350       }
02351       else
02352       {
02353             // Now we have the video object and surface, call the shadow function
02354             if(!Blt16BPPBufferShadowRectAlternateTable(pBuffer, uiPitch, &area))
02355             {
02356                   // Blit has failed if false returned
02357                   return( FALSE );
02358             }
02359       }
02360 
02361       // Mark as dirty if it's the backbuffer
02362       //if ( uiDestVSurface == BACKBUFFER )
02363       //{
02364       //    InvalidateBackbuffer( );
02365       //}
02366 
02367       UnLockVideoSurface( uiDestVSurface );
02368       return( TRUE );
02369 }

02375 }

02379 {

02381 }

02384 //
02385 // BltVSurfaceUsingDDBlt will always use Direct Draw Blt,NOT BltFast
02386 BOOLEAN BltVSurfaceUsingDDBlt( HVSURFACE hDestVSurface, HVSURFACE hSrcVSurface, UINT32 fBltFlags, INT32 iDestX, INT32 iDestY, RECT *SrcRect, RECT *DestRect )
02387 {
02388       UINT32            uiDDFlags;
02389 
02390       // Default flags
02391       uiDDFlags = DDBLT_WAIT;
02392 
02393       // Convert flags into DD flags, ( for transparency use, etc )
02394       if ( fBltFlags & VS_BLT_USECOLORKEY )
02395       {
02396             uiDDFlags |= DDBLT_KEYSRC;
02397       }
02398 
02399       DDBltSurface( (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hDestVSurface->pSurfaceData, DestRect, (LPDIRECTDRAWSURFACE2)hSrcVSurface->pSurfaceData,
02400                                     SrcRect, uiDDFlags, NULL );
02401 
02402       // Update backup surface with new data
02403       if ( hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_VIDEO_MEM_USAGE && !(hDestVSurface->fFlags & VSURFACE_RESERVED_SURFACE) )
02404       {
02405             UpdateBackupSurface( hDestVSurface );
02406       }
02407 
02408       return( TRUE );
02409 }

02412 //
02413 // This function will stretch the source image to the size of the dest rect.
02414 //
02415 // If the 2 images are not 16 Bpp, it returns false.
02416 //
02417 BOOLEAN BltStretchVideoSurface(UINT32 uiDestVSurface, UINT32 uiSrcVSurface, INT32 iDestX, INT32 iDestY, UINT32 fBltFlags, SGPRect *SrcRect, SGPRect *DestRect )
02418 {
02419       HVSURFACE   hDestVSurface;
02420       HVSURFACE   hSrcVSurface;
02421 
02422       #ifdef _DEBUG
02423             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_BLTSTRETCHVIDEOSURFACE_DST;
02424       #endif
02425       if( !GetVideoSurface( &hDestVSurface, uiDestVSurface ) )
02426       {
02427             return FALSE;
02428       }
02429       #ifdef _DEBUG
02430             gubVSDebugCode = DEBUGSTR_BLTSTRETCHVIDEOSURFACE_SRC;
02431       #endif
02432       if( !GetVideoSurface( &hSrcVSurface, uiSrcVSurface ) )
02433       {
02434             return FALSE;
02435       }
02436 
02437       //if the 2 images are not both 16bpp, return FALSE
02438       if( (hDestVSurface->ubBitDepth != 16) && (hSrcVSurface->ubBitDepth != 16) )
02439             return(FALSE);
02440 
02441       if(!BltVSurfaceUsingDDBlt( hDestVSurface, hSrcVSurface, fBltFlags, iDestX, iDestY, (RECT*)SrcRect, (RECT*)DestRect ) )
02442       {
02443     //
02444             // VO Blitter will set debug messages for error conditions
02445     //
02446 
02447             return( FALSE );
02448       }
02449 
02450       return( TRUE );
02451 }
